metadata.Title: CVE-2019-3840 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A NULL pointer dereference flaw was discovered in libvirt before version 5.0.0 in the way it gets interface information through the QEMU agent. An attacker in a guest VM can use this flaw to crash libvirtd and cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3840` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-libvirt - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.8
libvirt-bin - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.8
libvirt-clients - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.8
libvirt-daemon - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.8
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-gluster - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.8
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-rbd - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.8
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-sheepdog - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.8
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-zfs - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.8
libvirt-daemon-system - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.8
libvirt-sanlock - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.8
libvirt-wireshark - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.8
libvirt0 - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvirt package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.0-1ubuntu8.8').
